description: A cent is a hundredth of a semitone.
name: Cents

description:
A string representing a duration relative to a measure.
  • "4n" = quarter note
  • "2m" = two measures
  • "8t" = eighth-note triplet
name: Notation

description: Normal values are within the range [0, 1].
name: NormalRange

description:
Decibels are a logarithmic unit of measurement which is useful for volume
 because of the logarithmic way that we perceive loudness. 0 decibels 
 means no change in volume. -10db is approximately half as loud and 10db 
 is twice is loud.
name: Decibels

description: Half-step note increments, i.e. 12 is an octave above the root. and 1 is a half-step up.
name: Interval

description: One millisecond is a thousandth of a second.
name: Milliseconds

description:
Frequency can be described similar to time, except ultimately the
 values are converted to frequency instead of seconds. A number
 is taken literally as the value in hertz. Additionally any of the 
 Time encodings can be used. Note names in the form
 of NOTE OCTAVE (i.e. C4) are also accepted and converted to their
 frequency value.
name: Frequency

description: A number representing a midi note.
name: MIDI

description:
A frequency represented by a letter name, 
 accidental and octave. This system is known as
 [Scientific Pitch Notation](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Scientific_pitch_notation).
name: Note

description: The value must be greater than or equal to 0.
name: Positive

description:
Ticks are the basic subunit of the Transport. They are
 the smallest unit of time that the Transport supports.
name: Ticks

description:
Time can be described in a number of ways. Read more [Time](https://github.com/Tonejs/Tone.js/wiki/Time).
  • Numbers, which will be taken literally as the time (in seconds).
  • Notation, ("4n", "8t") describes time in BPM and time signature relative values.
  • TransportTime, ("4:3:2") will also provide tempo and time signature relative times in the form BARS:QUARTERS:SIXTEENTHS.
  • Frequency, ("8hz") is converted to the length of the cycle in seconds.
  • Now-Relative, ("+1") prefix any of the above with "+" and it will be interpreted as "the current time plus whatever expression follows".
  • Expressions, ("3:0 + 2 - (1m / 7)") any of the above can also be combined into a mathematical expression which will be evaluated to compute the desired time.
  • No Argument, for methods which accept time, no argument will be interpreted as "now" (i.e. the currentTime).
name: Time

description:
A colon-separated representation of time in the form of
 BARS:QUARTERS:SIXTEENTHS.
name: TransportTime
